title: True Color (24bit RGB) support
author: XVilka
body_snippet:
For the terminal emulation feature:

# Terminal Colors

There exists common confusion about terminal colors. This is what we have right now:

- Plain ASCII
- ANSI escape codes: 16 color codes with bold/italic and background
- 256 color palette: 216 colors + 16 ANSI + 24 gray (colors are 24-bit)
- 24-bit true color: "888" colors (aka 16 milion)

```bash
printf "\x1b[${bg};2;${red};${green};${blue}m\n"
```

The 256-color palette is configured at start and is a 666-cube of colors,
e...

comments.snippet:
Leaving this open so we can review after #181 

We make minor customization to PuTTY and ship it as PuTTYNG - we don't have any plans at this time to further enhance or contribute to PuTTY directly. You may want to open a wishlist item with the upstream maintainer(s):
https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/wishlist/
comments.author: kmscode

comments.snippet: @kmscode yes, there is a patch + a message already sent to the maintainers: https://gist.github.com/XVilka/8346728#gistcomment-2199057
comments.author: XVilka
